title: Hungarian Goulash Recipe (Inspired by Mum's Version)
ingredients: 2 kg chicken pieces (bone-in or boneless, as preferred)
4‚Äì5 bacon stock cubes (or substitute with chicken stock cubes if unavailable)
1 can water (for each can of soup)
method: Heat a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat with a drizzle of oil.
Add the diced onions and saut√© until softened and lightly golden.
Pour in the two cans of tomato soup.
Fill each empty can with water and add to the pot (2 cans of water in total).
Stir well to combine. If you prefer a creamier texture, add the milk at this stage.
Add the chicken pieces, green capsicum slices, cubed potatoes, and stock cubes.
Stir to ensure the ingredients are evenly distributed.
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and let it simmer gently for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the peas in the last 10 minutes if using.
Taste the goulash and adjust seasoning as needed.
Serve hot in bowls, accompanied by crusty bread or over buttered noodles for a complete meal.

title: Chicken, Corn & Pea Soup (No Green Beans)
ingredients: 1kg chicken thigh fillets (or breast), whole or halved
360g frozen peas & corn mix (or 210g corn + 150g peas)
1/2 cup risoni or small pasta (optional, added near end)
Chopped parsley or chives for garnish
method: Turn Instant Pot to saut√© mode. Cook onion, garlic, carrot, and celery in a little oil (3‚Äì5 mins).
Add: chicken, stock, thyme, bay leaf, and potatoes.
Close lid and pressure cook for 12 mins (manual/high). Let pressure release naturally for at least 10 mins.
Open lid, remove chicken and shred with two forks.
Return shredded chicken to pot. Add peas and corn.
Switch to slow cooker mode (low) for 1‚Äì2 hours to gently cook the peas and blend flavors.
Stir in pasta for final 15‚Äì20 mins, or add cream just before serving.
Taste and season. Garnish with herbs if using.
timing: Total cooking time: 1.5-2.5 hours including pressure cooking and slow cooking phases

title: Split Pea & Ham Hock Soup (Pressure + Slow Cook Method)
ingredients: 1 kg smoked ham hock (or bacon hock)
500 g green split peas, rinsed and drained
5 cups water (or use low-sodium chicken stock for extra flavor)
Crusty bread and butter, to serve
method: Set your Instant Pot or pressure cooker to saut√© mode. Add olive oil or butter, then cook onions, celery, carrots, and garlic for about 5‚Äì7 minutes until softened and fragrant. Cancel saut√© mode.
Add split peas, potato (if using), ham hock, thyme, bay leaves, and water/stock. Do not salt yet ‚Äî ham hocks can be salty.
Seal the lid and pressure cook on high for 30 minutes. Allow natural release for at least 10‚Äì15 minutes before opening.
Take out the ham hock and set it aside to cool slightly.
Switch to slow cooker mode (or transfer contents to a slow cooker). Cook on low for 2 hours. This deepens the flavor and thickens the soup naturally.
Strip the skin, bones, and fat from the ham hock. Roughly chop the meat and return it to the pot. Stir to combine.
Taste and season with salt and pepper. Add a splash of vinegar or lemon juice if desired to brighten the flavor.
Ladle into bowls and serve hot with crusty bread and butter.
timing: Total Time: ~2.5‚Äì3 hours (30 min pressure + 2 hr slow cook + prep time)

title: Ultimate Instant Pot Beef Rendang
ingredients: 800g beef chuck, cut into 4‚Äì5 cm chunks

method: Set Instant Pot to Saut√© mode.
Add oil and saut√© onion until soft (2‚Äì3 minutes).

title: Mum's Lasagne
ingredients: 1 clove garlic, chopped (minced garlic will do)
method: Heat oil in large pan
Add onion, carrot and garlic. Cook until soft
Add beef mince, cook until brown
Stir in tomato paste, canned tomatoes and chicken stock

Remove from heat, stir in milk
Return to heat, stir until thick

title: Mums Self-Saucing Chocolate Pudding
ingredients: 2 tbsp (30g) unsalted butter, melted (or neutral oil)
method: Preheat your oven to 180¬∞C (350¬∞F)
Grease a 1.5L (6-cup) baking dish with butter or cooking spray
In the bowl of your Breville stand mixer, add the flour, cocoa powder, granulated sugar, baking powder, and salt
Using the flat beater on the 'Light Mixing' setting, stir until combined
Add milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract, then mix on the same setting until smooth
Pour the batter into the greased baking dish and spread evenly with a spatula
Combine the brown sugar and cocoa powder in a small bowl
Sprinkle this dry mixture evenly over the batter in the dish
Slowly pour the boiling water over the back of a spoon to cover the top (this ensures it doesn't disrupt the batter)
Place the dish in the oven and bake for 30‚Äì35 minutes or until the top is firm to the touch, and a luscious sauce is bubbling underneath
Allow the pudding to cool for about 5 minutes
Scoop into bowls, ensuring you get both the cake and the sauce
Serve with vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, or a dollop of custard
timing: Total Time: 50 minutes (15 min prep + 30-35 min baking + 5 min cooling)

title: Pork Carnitas (2 kg) ‚Äì Pressure Cooker + Air Fryer
ingredients: 2 kg pork shoulder, trimmed of excess fat and cut into 4‚Äì5 large chunks
